concept_data.title: discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation

summary: Discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation constitutes a violation of fundamental rights and freedoms within the European Union's legal framework. The EU has established various directives aimed at combating such discrimination, notably the Employment Equality Directive, which prohibits unequal treatment in the workplace. This concept underscores the importance of equality and non-discrimination, ensuring that individuals are not subjected to prejudice due to their sexual orientation. The EU's commitment to promoting human rights is reflected in its legal instruments, which seek to foster an inclusive society where all individuals can enjoy their rights without fear of discrimination.
